chapter.title: Reaching Agreements With Partners
chapter.para: When you have important dependencies on outside partners, you must reach agreement with them before completing your deployment. This chapter addresses reaching agreement with partners concerning federations and deployments where multiple actors share control. This chapter does not address business goals nor legal considerations though you must of course consider those aspects when planning the deployment.

section.title: Working With Service Owners
section.para: TODO: For each service owner, discuss need to agree on service levels, and on how the service levels will be met, monitored, supported. Discuss planning to meet their needs for training and documentation. Discuss planning for them to meet deployment service levels, including implementation of any changes to their service in order to accommodate the deployment.

section.title: Working With Application Owners
section.para: TODO: Discuss how to understand and set expectations about service levels. Consider how service levels are monitored and supported. Discuss planning to meet their needs for training and documentation. Discuss how to handle agent and client application registration and profiles, including agent installation, dynamic registration for OpenID Connect, etc. Discuss how policies are defined and managed. Discuss delegated administration and separation of duties.

section.title: Working With Operations
section.para: TODO: If you own the architecture and planning, but others own the service in production, or even in the labs, you must reach agreement with those in production operations. Discuss planning to meet their needs for training and documentation. Consider how they meet service level and support needs for the deployment, and how service levels will be met, monitored, supported.
